rename.from: After upgrading Netty to 4.2.4+ application is throwing java.lang.VerifyError on Android platform
rename.to: After upgrading Netty to 4.2.4+, application is throwing java.lang.VerifyError on Android platform 8/9/10/11/12

body: Almost certainly caused by #15504, but I'm not sure what we can do about it

> Almost certainly caused by [#15504](https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/15504), but I'm not sure what we can do about it

Thank you @yawkat for triaging it quickly.

**Known facts**
This issue is not seen on 4.2.3 version, so we can stay back on 4.2.3 as a quick mitigation from consumer side.
We have a vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-55163 on 4.2.3 and below versions, so we need a solution as well to fix this vulnerability.

Could you please share the plan of resolving it in an upcoming version ?
This issue will be impacting all the Android consumers in a similar fashion, because it's something we can't fix at little proxy layer.
@ajith211 It would probably be worth mentioning your Android/Dalvik version and checking on your side if upgrading it to the latest version fixes your issue.

> [@ajith211](https://github.com/ajith211) It would probably be worth mentioning your Android/Dalvik version and checking on your side if upgrading it to the latest version fixes your issue.

@slandelle Our test devices of Android 8/9/10/11/12 are on latest build version. So I think we can't upgrade the Dalivk/ART version in these devices
Android 10 has **ART version 2.1.0 arm64** where this **failure is happening**
Android 13 has **ART version 2.1.0 arm64** where this **failure is not happening**
So not sure whether Dalvik/ART version is playing a part in this issue
I think it is still possible to force not using var handle; if it is not, I would add some configurable perk or check (e.g. isAndroid) to not use var handle, if that's the problem

If things work on some Android versions and not on others, it really looks like a bug that should be reported to the Android team.
IMHO, the priority should be there: fixing the bug at the source instead of implementing a workaround downstream. My concern is that if Netty implements a workaround right away, the real bug will never be fixed.

Considering this failure is on older Android platforms like 8/9/10/11/12, we may not get any fix from Android team side, because they are not releasing any patches on these versions.
So it's worth to switch to the var handle logic based on Android version checks.

My guess is that on the Android versions in question, VarHandle is present, but not with PolymorphicSignature. Because the class file (and thus the dalvik) still contains the polymorphic calls though, ART sees a mismatch in the method signature and fails verification. 

If that's the case, fixing it on Android like @slandelle proposes is basically impossible. Old Android versions don't get updates, and when they do, they don't make it to devices. The only Android side fix I can think of would be if the VarHandle method signatures are somehow provided by the app for compatibility with old Android versions, in which case they may be tunable. But I wouldn't bet on it.

On the netty side, a workaround would be to move the VarHandle code to another class and avoid loading it on the affected android versions. Maybe putting the VarHandle.get calls into a static method would be enough, even. I'm pretty sure it needs to be in a different class though.

Either way, I don't think any of our regular contributors are android developers. I have quite a bit of experience on this so I could review but I can't justify using work time for actually building and testing a patch. So we might have to wait for someone from the community to do it.

> My guess is that on the Android versions in question, VarHandle is present, but not with PolymorphicSignature. Because the class file (and thus the dalvik) still contains the polymorphic calls though, ART sees a mismatch in the method signature and fails verification.
> 
> If that's the case, fixing it on Android like [@slandelle](https://github.com/slandelle) proposes is basically impossible. Old Android versions don't get updates, and when they do, they don't make it to devices. The only Android side fix I can think of would be if the VarHandle method signatures are somehow provided by the app for compatibility with old Android versions, in which case they may be tunable. But I wouldn't bet on it.
> 
> On the netty side, a workaround would be to move the VarHandle code to another class and avoid loading it on the affected android versions. Maybe putting the VarHandle.get calls into a static method would be enough, even. I'm pretty sure it needs to be in a different class though.
> 
> Either way, I don't think any of our regular contributors are android developers. I have quite a bit of experience on this so I could review but I can't justify using work time for actually building and testing a patch. So we might have to wait for someone from the community to do it.

We don't have netty domain experience, otherwise would love to contribute here. For verifying any development level patch releases from netty towards this issue, our team can help.

issue.title: Android: Disable VarHandle usage in android

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Older version of Android have buggy VarHandle implementations that will most likely never been fixed. Let's just disable VarHandle usage in this case

Modifications:

Just disable VarHandle usage on Android

Result:

Workaround for https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/15654

body: @ajith211 also you could use `-Dio.netty.varHandle.enabled=false` and see if android works again even without the changes maybe.

> [@ajith211](https://github.com/ajith211) could you verify [#15657](https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/15657)

@normanmaurer Do we have a netty artifact corresponding to this PR for us to consume ?
